sentences.zh: 太史公讀列封至便侯，曰：有以也夫！

translations.text: The Grand Historian read the list of enfeoffments down to the Marquis of Bian and said: 'There is a reason for this!'

sentences.zh: 長沙王者，著令甲，稱其忠焉。

translations.text: The King of Changsha was recorded in the statutes as one who demonstrated loyalty.

sentences.zh: 昔高祖定天下，功臣非同姓疆土而王者八國。

translations.text: In the past, when Gaozu pacified the empire, among the meritorious ministers who were not of the same surname as the imperial family and were enfeoffed as kings, there were eight states.

sentences.zh: 至孝惠時，唯獨長江全，禪五世，禪五世，以無嗣絕，意無過，為藩守職，信矣。

translations.text: By the time of Emperor Hui, only the Jiang family remained complete, passing the throne through five generations, passing the throne through five generations, and because there was no heir, it came to an end. In intention there was no fault; they served as regional guardians with good faith.

sentences.zh: 故其澤流枝庶，毋功而侯者數人。

translations.text: Therefore, their beneficence flowed to branches and descendants, and several persons became marquises without merit.

sentences.zh: 及孝惠訖孝景閒五十載，追修高祖時遣功臣，及從代來，吳楚之勞，諸侯子弟若肺腑，外國歸義，封者九十有餘。

translations.text: From Emperor Hui to the period between Emperor Hui and Emperor Jing, over fifty years, they pursued and honored the meritorious ministers from Gaozu's time, as well as those who followed from Dai, and the laborers of Wu and Chu, the sons of nobles like close relatives, and foreigners who submitted to righteousness. Those enfeoffed numbered more than ninety.

sentences.zh: 咸表始終，當世仁義成功之著者也。

translations.text: All displayed their beginnings and ends, and were the prominent ones of contemporary benevolence, righteousness, achievement, and success.

The Grand Historian read the list of enfeoffments down to the Marquis of Bian and said: 'There is a reason for this!' The King of Changsha was recorded in the statutes as one who demonstrated loyalty. In the past, when Gaozu pacified the empire, among the meritorious ministers who were not of the same surname as the imperial family and were enfeoffed as kings, there were eight states. By the time of Emperor Hui, only the Jiang family remained complete, passing the throne through five generations, passing the throne through five generations, and because there was no heir, it came to an end. In intention there was no fault; they served as regional guardians with good faith. Therefore, their beneficence flowed to branches and descendants, and several persons became marquises without merit. From Emperor Hui to the period between Emperor Hui and Emperor Jing, over fifty years, they pursued and honored the meritorious ministers from Gaozu's time, as well as those who followed from Dai, and the laborers of Wu and Chu, the sons of nobles like close relatives, and foreigners who submitted to righteousness. Those enfeoffed numbered more than ninety. All displayed their beginnings and ends, and were the prominent ones of contemporary benevolence, righteousness, achievement, and success.
